intro: Ichnanthus harmandii, commonly known as the Harmand's ichnanthus, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It belongs to the family Onagraceae, which includes willows and evening primroses. The plant is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in late spring. It typically grows in moist, sandy soils along stream banks and in open woodlands. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological studies and conservation efforts.
